#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Get Along With Conceptual
#Text=Thinkers
#Text=Ever dealt with someone who cannot put anything in concrete terms ?
#Text=Someone who speaks big words and has a broad image of how the world works , but whenever you try to get specifics out of them , it 's like herding cats ?
#Text=Steps
#Text=Take stock of the individual 's relevance / importance for your everyday life .
#Text=The more important the person is the more you should make an effort to relate to them ( and them to you ) .
#Text=Explain things on their terms .
#Text=For example , is it important to convey to your dad what your college major classes are about ?

#Text=If this matters to you think about " transferable skills " and important lessons you learn - your dad may not care to know about the second derivative problem you failed on the exam if he 's a conceptual thinker and not a math-whiz .

column1: #Text=Do you need to explain to your roommate why you need to be alone on Friday night in the apartment ?
#Text=If he or she is a conceptual thinker they will be confused by all your literal ( and detailed ) Friday evening plans .
#Text=Hearing concepts such as " privacy " , " personal space " , " date " , " movie night " may be more important to them than the details of who your date is or what movie you are planning to see .

column1: #Text=If you are planning to do something with them , patiently and respectfully of your thinking styles try to get them to commit to concrete steps or specifics about what will you do .

#Text=For example , if your friend talks about " big life change " plans , get her or him to commit to running once a week with you , start an online dating profile , or pick up the call and inquire about open position about her or his dream job .
#Text=Conceptual thinkers sometimes have a hard time making their plans concrete because they need to think about details .
#Text=Help them ( and they can help you think in conceptual terms about your business idea , or your career/ life plans ) .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Conceptual and literal thinkers may have a hard time getting along but , with the right communication skills and patience , they can be wonderful life or work partners .
#Text=Think for example of CEO-COO teams : the CEO is in change of vision , mission , inspiring people ; the COO spends time on the nitty-gritty of everyday life .
#Text=Both are important , and the two have to work together as a team : mission without good execution is bad , and so is execution without good , clear mission .
#Text=Check out How to Get Along With Literal Thinkers .
#Text=You may be one of them in which case conceptual thinkers will make you very uncomfortable with their high-level ideas .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Working with someone of an opposite thinking type can be both a blessing and a curse ( and sometimes both at the same time ) .
#Text=Learn to recognize and use each other 's strengths .
